name: Call of Cthulhu: Shadow of the Comet
description: You'll take on the role of John T. Carter, a brilliant young astronomer, piecing together the puzzling history of the village and its cryptic inhabitants. Incredibly realistic action and supernatural chaos intertwine to draw players deep into the puzzling mysteries within the Shadow of the Comet.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 2.0 GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 256 MB VRAM DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 100 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Mister Paaaaaaaaarker, you must solve the puzzles that make no sense! But really, it's pretty fun, even if there are a few BS puzzles. Having to look up how to develop film comes to mind. If you want to play one of the grandfthers of Cthulhu Mythos Games, this is it, besides the OG Alone in the Dark. There are a lot worse things to spend 6 bucks on, just try not to take it as seriously as it tries to present itself. It's a tad too silly to take seriouslyat times, such as literally flying. I'll let you decide WHICH time Parker flies I'm talking about.  Seriously, though, Steam, the guy's name is 'Parker'.
